document_data.name: Wheep
document_data.location:
[[Crypt of Augathra the Mad]], [[Anauroch]], [[north Faer√ªn]]
[[Negative Energy plane]]
document_data.distinctions: Wailing in pain, gouged eyes that secreted back poisonous bile.
document_data.mainbody: '''Wheeps''' were miserable, poisonous and eyeless [[undead]] creatures, stuck in unending torture of pain, often serving as guards or minions of more powerful undead beings.
document_data.Description:
Wheeps were horrifying in appearance, reminiscent of victims of unimaginable tortures. They had empty sockets that leaked foul thick black ichor that left slithering marks all over their faces and bodies and covered their clawed hands and feet. These creatures constantly wailed and moaned in pain while gargling on the ichor that flowed into their mouths.

Wheeps generally were of an average size for a [[humanoid]], {{SI|6'|'"|long=yes}}, weighting around {{SI|200|lb|k|long=yes}}. They possessed unnatural strength, empowered by their unending pain and sorrow.
document_data.Abilities: Said vile black bile that dripped out of their empty orbs was a potent [[poison]] that usually decomposed and evaporated within an hour after being secreted. When introduces into the victim's bloodstream, this poison spread through the body, slowly killing the target; however, the poison's effects dissipated after an hour in the victim's body.
document_data.Personality:
Wheeps always cried, wailed, and sniffled quite loudly and, unless they tried to remain undetected, could be heard from afar. They were easy to track due to the constantly exuding black poison that splattered the ground where these creatures passed.

Wheeps could communicate in [[Common]].
document_data.Combat: Even though these creatures often announced their presence with bone-chilling gargling wail, their main weapons were poisoned claws and bites. However, these horrific cries could almost certainly unnerve the creatures' opponents, leading them shaken. When in combat, wheeps moved with an unholy grace, making them hard to hit or pin down.
document_data.Ecology: As undead creatures, wheeps held no place in the natural world. They were often used by more powerful undead as bodyguards, servants and sent out on tasks of desecrating heavily-guarded cemeteries, stealing corpses of respected, powerful, and beloved individuals.
document_data.History: In the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], wheeps were inhabiting the [[Crypt of Augathra the Mad]] in the desert of [[Anauroch]], serving a dreaded [[death tyrant]] who laired there.
